name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of New York

originInfo.publisher: Administrative Office of the United States Courts

titleInfo.title: Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.

name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of New York

titleInfo.title: Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM-DECISION&ORDER: granting in part and denying in part the # 13 Motion for Preliminary Injunction as follows: the motion is denied insofar as it relates to Plaintiff's model Q-360 air terminal. It is further ordered that plaintiffs are hereby enjoined from the further manufacture, use, sale, and/or offer for sale of its model Q-4 air terminal. Signed by Senior Judge Neal P. McCurn on 7/24/08. (jmb)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:08-cv-00317; Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of New York
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM-DECISION&ORDER: granting in part and denying in part the # 13 Motion for Preliminary Injunction as follows: the motion is denied insofar as it relates to Plaintiff's model Q-360 air terminal. It is further ordered that plaintiffs are hereby enjoined from the further manufacture, use, sale, and/or offer for sale of its model Q-4 air terminal. Signed by Senior Judge Neal P. McCurn on 7/24/08. (jmb)

titleInfo.title: Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM-DECISION&ORDER: granting the # 34 Motion for Summary Judgment in its entirety, Plaintiff's are hereby permanently enjoined from the further manufacture, use, sale and/or offer for sale of its model Q-4 air terminal; granting the # 47 Motion for Summary Judgment in its entirety, and further the Court rules denying the # 80 Motion for Leave to File supplemental papers in opposition to the motion for summary judgment. Remaining for resolution at trial is the issue of Airtex's claim for damages on their counterclaim against Plaintiffs. Signed by Senior Judge Neal P. McCurn on 1/10/2011. (jmb)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:08-cv-00317; Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of New York
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM-DECISION&ORDER: granting the # 34 Motion for Summary Judgment in its entirety, Plaintiff's are hereby permanently enjoined from the further manufacture, use, sale and/or offer for sale of its model Q-4 air terminal; granting the # 47 Motion for Summary Judgment in its entirety, and further the Court rules denying the # 80 Motion for Leave to File supplemental papers in opposition to the motion for summary judgment. Remaining for resolution at trial is the issue of Airtex's claim for damages on their counterclaim against Plaintiffs. Signed by Senior Judge Neal P. McCurn on 1/10/2011. (jmb)

titleInfo.title: Nuclimate Air Quality Systems, Inc., et al v. M&I Heat Transfer Products, Ltd.
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT DISMISSING ACTION BY REASON OF SETTLEMENT: this action is DISMISSED in its entirety without prejudice to the right of the parties to secure reinstatement of the case within thirty (30) days after the date of this judgment by making a showing that the settlement was not, in fact, consummated; and in the event that no request is made for reinstatement within thirty (30) days of the date of this judgment, the dismissal of this case shall thereafter be with prejudice. It is further ORDERED that Defendant reserves its right to appeal District Judge Neal McCurns January 10, 2011 Memorandum-Decision and Order granting the Plaintiff Summary Judgment dismissing defendants claim for permanent injunction with regard to the Q360. Said Notice of Appeal must be filed within thirty (30) days from the date of this judgment. (lmw)

It is further ORDERED that Defendant reserves its right to appeal District Judge Neal McCurns January 10, 2011 Memorandum-Decision and Order granting the Plaintiff Summary Judgment dismissing defendants claim for permanent injunction with regard to the Q360.
